intro: Tagetes silenoides, commonly known as the Mexican marigold, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow to orange flowers and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in full sun with well-drained soil. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are arranged in a cluster at the top of the stem. Tagetes silenoides is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
